newsitem.title: USA: Comcast Reports third-quarter loss of $10 million.
newsitem.headline: Comcast Reports third-quarter loss of $10 million.

text.p: Comcast Corp., the cable television and cellular phone company, said Monday it lost $10 million in the third quarter due to financing costs and non-cash charges, principally from acquisitions.

The Philadelphia-based company, which is the majority owner of home shopping network QVC, said the loss equalled 4 cents per share. This compared with a net loss of $7.4 million, or 3 cents a share, a year ago.
Revenues rose 12 percent to $975 million from $870 million a year earlier. The company said its operating cash flow also rose 12 percent to $296 million.
Comcast said its cable division reported a 6.6 percent rise in revenue, while its cellular division reported a 12.5 percent increase in revenues.
QVC reported third quarter revenue growth of 10 percent, despite competition for viewers from the Summer Olympics. Comcast became a principal owned of QVC in February, 1995.

"As we gear up for an active fourth quarter we are enthusiastic about the prospects of each of our core businesses," Comcast President Brian Roberts said in a statement. "In particular, the cable division is continuing to aggressively upgrade its network infrastructure and customer service platforms to provide a broader and richer array of programming to our customers."
Comcast also has a majority stake in a partnership grouping the Philadelphia 76ers basketball team, the Philadelphia Flyers hockey team, and two sports arenas.

For the first nine months, the company said it lost $28 million, or 11 cents a share, on revenue of $2.87 billion. A year earlier, the company posted a loss of $32.2 million, or 15 cents a share, on revenue of $2.36 billion.
